channel.title: Donations..?
channel.description:
I know this mod is free and all, but id love the opportunity to donate money to the devs after playing the game through. The amount i donated would depend on how much i enjoyed it. If i was blown away i would probably donate about £20 (which is about $40 afaik). If i thought it was a good game then probs £5-£10.
Will there be a way for customers to donate money to the well deserved devs?
How many of you are willing to donate money?
Sorry if this has come up before <3
rezO

item.title: Donations..?
item.dc:creator: brokenfridgehinge
item.description:
quoting from FAQ:

HOW MUCH WILL BLACK MESA COST: This is a FREE modification, and as such there will be no charge to download. Many people have voiced that they would be willing to pay for work of such quality, however, the legal ramifications of charging for making a mod are fairly clear. To put it short, it won’t happen.

Please use the search function/read the FAQ next time.

Read full topic

item.title: Donations..?
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
If you really want to spend your money, feel free to send it to me. PM me for my paypal.

Read full topic

item.title: Donations..?
item.dc:creator: Sampdel
item.description:
JohnKiller118:

We get it. The mod looks amazing. Accept the fact that it’s free and move on!

Remember when people said “I would pay moniez to buy Garry’s Mod,” and when Garry’s Mod 10 was released on Steam for $10 everyone was like “fuck you Garry sellout lol fags!”

People are so retarded.

Its so true.

Read full topic

item.title: Donations..?

item.description:
That would be correct. The devs cannot accept money. Period.

Read full topic

item.title: Donations..?
item.dc:creator: Mangled
item.description:
Technically you could legally donate, so long as it wasn’t toward the development of the mod. It could be towards maintaining the website or towards a real Hummerang for Raminator.

Though I expect the devs will still say no.

Read full topic

item.title: Donations..?
item.dc:creator: I_amp_lt_3Tacos
item.description:
As stated by Raminator in another thread:

Thank you for the kind offer, but even if we wanted money, we couldn’t allow you guys to send it to us. It’s a very grey legal area; we’re not using our own technology or licensing someone else’s, and we’re not using our own intellectual property. However, advertising revenue helps keep the site and forums afloat, and our prize from winning ModDB’s unreleased mod of the year helps us to buy software and cover other mod-related costs.

Read full topic

item.title: Donations..?
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
Not much of a reward if you already have a job, however. But these guys are going to be heroes in the world of game development if they stick the landing (30 days baby!)

Read full topic

item.title: Donations..?
item.dc:creator: Dillxn
item.description:
It will be something amazing to put on their résumés / portfolios to say the least.

Read full topic

item.title: Donations..?
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
The developer team can’t accept any money whatsoever for this project, because they are recreating something they don’t have copyrights to. Hopefully they will be compensated by epic fame and prestige for creating one of the most ambitious mods ever (also adsense?), but thats all.

Read full topic

item.title: Donations..?
item.dc:creator: Dillxn
item.description:
It amazes me how people would rather start a new thread than type a few words into the search box. One word in this case. The developers have no will to accept donations, nor legal rights to. They have not licensed the engine, and it is not their IP but Valve’s.

Read full topic
